snippet: On display in New York, fabrics that somehow survived time’s decay reflect the wealth and social standing of the elite in the late Roman Empire.
abstract: Exhibition at Manhattan's Institute for the Study of the Ancient World features rich trove of Mediterranean textiles dating from third to seventh century; objects illustrate intricate ways in which Roman elite used clothing to indicate their social standing and wealth.
lead_paragraph: On display in New York, fabrics that somehow survived time’s decay reflect the wealth and social standing of the elite in the late Roman Empire.

headline.main: In Late Antiquity Textiles, a Long-Lasting Fashion Show
